intro: Haplopappus vicuniensis, commonly known as the Andean pappus, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and feathery pappus structures. The plant typically grows in high-altitude environments, thriving in cool, arid conditions. Its small yellow flowers are arranged in dense clusters, and it produces a distinctive, wind-dispersed seed system. Haplopappus vicuniensis is adapted to harsh mountain climates and plays a role in local ecosystems.
